snippet: Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the majority leader, warned that the Senate could be held in session over the weekend if there was no progress on the immigration bill.
abstract: Senate Democratic leaders seek to spur their colleagues to pick up pace as immigration debate enters its second week, with Majority Leader Harry Reid threatening to hold Senate in session over weekend if no progress is made on legislation.
lead_paragraph: Senator Harry Reid of Nevada, the majority leader, warned that the Senate could be held in session over the weekend if there was no progress on the immigration bill.

headline.main: Top Democrats in Senate Urge Faster Action
headline.print_headline: Top Democrats In Senate Urge Faster Action
